The capital city is Abéché. The region was the heartland of the former Ouaddai Empire, which existed from the early 16th century until 1911. It was defeated by France in the Ouaddai War. == Subdivisions == Since 2008, the region of Ouaddaï is divided into three departments: Department Capital Sub-prefectures Abdi Abdi (ville) Abdi, Abkar Djombo, Biyeré Assoungha Adré Adré, Hadjer Hadid, Mabrone, Borota, Molou, Tourane Ouara Abéché Abéché, Abougoudam, Chokoyan, Bourtaïl, Amleyouna, Gurry, Marfa ==References== Category:Regions of Chad
title: Ouaddaï Region
